localised_description: Though the bulk of the Warpstone Meteors now crash at the foot of Crookback Mountain, the Grey Seers lost control of an exceptionally large Meteor that has fallen near the Silver Pinnacle. The Lahmians have sent their deathless thralls to secure the precious substance for their own dark designs. Cursing the Grey Seers for their incompetence, Tretch gathers his finest Stormvermin and sets out to intercept the Lahmians at once.\\n

The ranks of the Ruinous Ones were no easy feat to bring down. Norscans, Beastmen, the warhost of disciples from the Chaos Wastes itself – all the twisted Chaos-things which drew their immense strength from beyond the void, from the very realm of Chaos itself. This was the strength which Snikch’s master craved.

The location of the great power was finally revealed to Snikch through the words of the Chaos warhost’s Sorcerer, who had vainly attempted to bargain for his own release. “You are a fool, ratling peon,” the Sorcerer shrieked, “for the power you seek is a Daemon of Slaanesh, and no minor Daemon at that! Tz’arkan, the Drinker of Worlds, is a ravenous monster inextricably bound to the soul of a living entity. The only chance of severing the Chaos-imbued bond is to destroy the vessel in which the Daemon is trapped. That vessel is none other than the Druchii known as Malus Darkblade.”

The prospect of wielding the power of a Daemon suddenly sounded very good to the Deathmaster. Almost as soon as he’d ordered his spies to find Darkblade’s location, word returned that the Druchii tyrant was in the area, but about to board his Black Ark back to Naggaroth. He cannot be allowed to escape!
localised_mission_completed_text: Success! You have achieved one of your goals.
